title: How to Dry Kangaroo Paws

steps.headline: Select the blooms you'd like to keep.
steps.description: Choose ones that are unblemished and in their prime. They are best picked when they have just started to come out in bloom.

steps.headline: Pick the blooms on a dry and sunny day.
steps.description: The best time for picking them is the late afternoon before it gets damp in the evening, following a full day's sunshine.

steps.headline: Tie the blooms together gently onto a coat hanger.
steps.description: Hang them upside down when tying.

steps.headline: Drape a sheet of tissue paper over the hanger and the blooms.
Hang up in a dry and dark place.
steps.description: Make sure that there is plenty of ventilation. The darkness is important to help retain the original colour of the bloom.

steps.headline: Check now and then.
steps.description: The flowers are dried completely when they feel crisp to the touch.

tyn: Dry, dark and airy spot to hang for drying
